TopicTitle: Kerbal Flight Industries Aurora (Multi-Purpose Crew Vehicle)

Articles.Content:
Introducing the KFI Aurora MPCV, a new orbiter from Kerbal Flight Industries! This versatile vehicle comes with a noob-friendly overdone launcher and carries three crew and a bunch of functionality to add to your LKO space program.

Tips for flight:

1. Start with throttle at two ticks above the one-third mark.

2. Double tap '1' to de-activate gimbal on the Rockomax engines.

3. Fly to 10,000 meters with appropriate throttle adjustments to be at around 200 m/s when there.

4. Press '1' to re-activate gimbal, turn over to 45 degrees, and up throttle.

5. Continue slowly turning over until you reach 90 degrees when going around 1000 m/s.

6. Raise apokerb and circularize at desired orbit.

7. Unfold solar panels and antennae, then celebrate!

8. Don't forget to de-orbit the circularization stage using the built in probe body. No space debris!

Unique (and totally not stolen from Scott Manley) use of batteries for night lighting during dockings!

----Action Groups----

1: Toggle gimbal on Rockomax engines,

2: Toggle solar panels.

3: Open shield on docking port.

4: Toggle antennae.

5: Toggle docking lights.

NOTE: The Poodle engine was buffed at sometime that I did not notice until now, and I highly recommend it due to its new higher vacuum ISP!
